website_summaries.verdict: Offers a lot of litter by a trusted brand for a low price – the one to pick for budget-minded owners or those with multiple cats.
pros: of clumping litter with Purina's TidyLock Protection that does a good job of controlling odors
Earns praise for its hard-clumping action
cons: The box is heavy and challenging for some users to handle, and the litter produces more dust than pricier options

website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality cat litter that produces easy-to-discard clumps.
pros: The Tidy Cats formula is absorbent, causing clumps to form and dry quickly
There is minimal dust produced, and the litter is not easily tracked throughout your home
The litter actively combats cat odors for multiple days without scooping
The resealable packaging is excellent for storing and keeping the litter fresh

customer_reviews.title: Updated review, Too dusty & fragranced
customer_reviews.text: Changing updating my review! before I had a glowing review on this, but I realized after using this and seeing my cat sneeze more that this is still way to dusty!! & fragranced, When tidy had what they called there "premium" lineup a few years back with Breathe easy, Small spaces & power blend they were more focused on the dust control and they were better all around & they need to return to that!
customer_reviews.author: LandmarkC

customer_reviews.title: Likes to stick to the sides and bottom of the litter box.
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the worst litter I have ever used for our cat's litter box. We have one cat and this litter likes to make huge clumps that stick to the bottom and sides of the cat box. We have one of the boxes that has the tray to pull out to empty and it makes the clumps so big you have to break them up to get them out of the litter box. Will not be buying this litter again. Seems like a lot of this litter is wasted due to the clumping. Will be going back to the previous litter I was using.
customer_reviews.author: Dollar Dollar Bill Y'all

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Never again.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst cat litter I have ever used. I had it on auto ship, and the first 40lb pail was okay. It worked fine, and did its job. The second pail, however, was terrible. It was dusty, smelled like chemicals, and emitted a eye-burning vapor that made me dread (even more so) cleaning the litter box. It turns out that my cats felt the same way, and started peeing in the corners of my house to avoid having to pee in the vapor box. Do not buy this litter from amazon, as it is an inconsistent product and you+ your kitties will greatly regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Fiona

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality anymore!!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this product on subscription for a while now and have always liked it. However, they have recently changed the litter and it’s not as good as it used to be. The litter seems more fine than before so the clumps do not hold together. We have an automatic litter box and this product no longer works for us. I’m going back to our old cat litter from now on.
customer_reviews.author: JK DubTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Does not conceal the smell.
customer_reviews.text: Let's say your cat has a bowel movement and excretes their fecal matter into this litter. Buries it up to the best of their ability, shakes off their paws, and goes on about their day laying around and whatnot. Well have no doubt that the pile of deuce from their early morning litter box appointment will linger around and find it's way to your nostrils letting you know that cats, just like humans, discharge unpleasant medium from their posterior alimentary canal. If you buy this litter, might as well train your cat to defecate like a proper human on a toilet and flush their doings thereafter.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Environmentally friendly!
customer_reviews.text: Love that they’re sending this in a bag now and not wasting plastic or large cardboard boxes to hold the litter. I just pour it into my empty clean litter container. I only have one cat and I scoop his box daily. Our housekeeper assured me that she can’t smell the box, so I stick with this brand. I gave 4 stars because there was more very fine granules of litter — sand-like — in this bag than I’ve ever had with this brand. I hope they’re not using a lesser-quality litter in the bags. I’ll find out with my next purchase of the litter in a bag.
customer_reviews.author: SFDalMom

customer_reviews.title: You'll know when it needs changing, 0 to smelly real quick
customer_reviews.text: We've used this litter for several months and the main advantage is it's delivered to our door. This online exclusive formula doesn't last as long as the same kind they sell in stores. However, convenience and price factored in we continue using this one. Once the litter starts going bad it goes really fast and doesn't clump and smells terrible. But if you can keep up with changing the litter it's not bad.
customer_reviews.author: I buy a lot of stuff. Sometimes I tell you about it.

customer_reviews.title: Best Brand/Formula
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple indoor cats so a good litter is vital to quality and cleanliness of my home. I have tried all sorts of brands and formulas of cat litter and I have found no magical substance that totally eliminates the tracking of it. So this stuff does track a bit, but not as bad as other brands I’ve used. With that being said, this stuff clumps really well and makes scooping the cat box a breeze. The clumps also mean that ammonia isn’t left behind in the box, which eliminates smells and prolongs the time needed between changing all the litter in the box. I’m a loyal customer to this brand and formula.
customer_reviews.author: Marlee

customer_reviews.title: Clumps well, traps odor, price is good as any
customer_reviews.text: For a 40 lb container of cat litter, this works as good as any. Normally, i would have used Dr Elsey's, however the price was temporarily very high, so I just went with something else expecting similar results. Such was the case. Important points: - Low dust - Clumps well - Traps Odor - Scoops easily - Price is right. Cons? I can't really think of any at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Do not like this cat litter
customer_reviews.text: Do not like this cat litter. Does not clump urine well at all, falls apart and leaves small pieces all over the litter box when I try to scoop it out, and my cats track it all over the house, I'm constantly vacuuming or sweeping up cat litter. Also, it sticks to my cats paws and I'm having to clean them several times a week. This is more of a headache than it's worth. Back to looking for another cat litter that works without severe aggravation. The only good thing about this litter is it has very little dust.
customer_reviews.author: FindingAmore

customer_reviews.title: Very good, clean cat litter in a nice strong paper bag!
customer_reviews.text: I’m extremely sensitive to fragrances and also picky about litter quality. This works well and doesn’t stink. It’s not that dusty (certainly not as bad as other brands I’ve tried) and I love the paper bags. It’s great having it delivered, too. No more plastic and no more hesitating at buying more expensive light weight litter to make it easier to carry for me! I bag lasts me two weeks and it seems fairly priced to me.
customer_reviews.author: Lela Ellsworth

customer_reviews.title: but that's pretty normal with these types of litter
customer_reviews.text: My go to when Dr. Elsey's Precious Cat Ultra Clumping Cat Litter is not available. It really helps cut down on smell and clumps well. I tried a different litter (HEB brand) and the smell control just doesn't compare to this one or Elsey's. Tracking is a nightmare, but that's pretty normal with these types of litter.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Little

customer_reviews.title: Instant headache from “deodorizing system”
customer_reviews.text: Whatever is in this liter was incredibly potent. Awful. I would Much rather smell cat sh*£. :/ I’m the most frugal person ever and I had To stop using this stuff. 😞 I had no idea deodorizing system meant such potent fragrance ...even the garage smells of this liters potent fragrance. Thankfully tomorrow is garbage day.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: The best thing is the four easily liftable eco-friendly packages.
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for packaging an excellent non-lightweight litter this way. Eternally grateful. Seriously. This works really well with the SpeediSift Litter Boxes, which I've started using. The combination makes a huge difference to me. I have pulmonary problems, and lifting isn't easy. This makes it possible for me to buy 48 lbs at a time and move it into the house 12 pounds at a time. Yes, physics tells us that's the SAME amount of "work," but trust me, it makes a huge difference if you can't lift stuff. (I do still feel sorry for the package carriers, my USPS and UPS and FedEx delivery heroines and heroes. )
customer_reviews.author: quizquest

customer_reviews.title: Never Again.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the good review, first mistake. I've been buying litter for 16 years and this stuff is horrible. The smell is terrible and reeks of ammonia. Which makes sense because it doesn't absorb and the urine pools in the bottom of the litter box. It also tracks. It sticks horribly to cats paws, our feet, and ends up in our carpet and beds (EWW). It doesn't clump well, is hard to clean, and stinks. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Kachel

customer_reviews.title: Fake?
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, I feel like this is a knock off litter. I have no idea why someone would do that though. I’ve always used Tidy Cats. I like the fact it clumps and keeps the ammonia smell down. I bought two twenty lb jugs this time, I’ve done it before. For some reason, this one seems way off. No clumping, super ammonia smelling, can’t get it out of the box. I’m just wondering why a product I’ve bought forever is this weird.
customer_reviews.author: girliemonster

customer_reviews.title: My experience
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many Purina products in my life. I have a serv-pal, a calico 18yrs. She's indoor. This box of 'stuff' is nothing more than SAND! Might as well gone to a cement sand pile and scooped it with a shovel. A few particles that track that are supposed to stop the smell (they do) and SAND. It tracks EVeRywhere! It's small and extremely hard to clean up entirely. I walk on it to get around the box and it sticks to my feet, shoes, slippers, or socks also. There is no way to avoid the excessive amount of tracking! This is my experience. I won't buy Tidy Cats again.
customer_reviews.author: Mel ChampionTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Oh god smells so bad
customer_reviews.text: Switch to this litter because the other one i order is no longer on amazon. This litter does not cover up the smell whatsoever. I just changed the litter yesterday and already it smells awful. Do not recommend, especially if you have a boy cat. My cat (girl) usually does not have smelly urine but there must be something in this litter than exasperates the smell. yuck.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Clumps break apart!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't know whether this was a bad box or Tidy Cats has cheapened the quality of their product or if it doesn't work in higher humidity, but either way this was the worst litter I've ever used. The clumps didn't stick together at all, instead collapsing apart when trying to scoop them up. This repeatedly resulted in a fog of pee-infused cat litter dust being ejected into the air, making my whole body (and the whole house) smell. For comparison, I recently bought some Arm and Hammer litter and the clumps are hard as a rock, perfect for scooping. And unlike the Tidy Cats litter there is no offensive pee smell or dust.
customer_reviews.author: Spock

customer_reviews.title: No clumping or odor removal powers - AVOID
customer_reviews.text: Please avoid. Initially the litter smells great, although don’t get too close because the dust cloud will choke you out after pouring. Unfortunately the scent, which is probably too perfumed for animals anyway, doesn’t last and DEFINITELY does not remove odors. The cat poop does not stick and that’s great but the urine? Forget about it, what a muddy mess this litter makes. Absolutely no clumping powers and the litter scoop / box needs to be scrubbed down outside after each use. Terrible, I’ll be switching back to my regular brand and tossing this, not even worth donating it’s that bad.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee W

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: Completely unhappy.. I purchased these 1. Because I was expecting the picture and what was described not this stuff. 2. Absorbing and comparing to what I was supposed to get HORRIBLE absolutely trash! Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: Staytrue

customer_reviews.title: Horrible clumping and does NOT hide odor
customer_reviews.text: I have one cat I recently switched to this cause of the reviews and bulk/price was reasonable... oh man was I wrong to switch. after a month of trying this out it sucks!!! Clumps horribly sticking to the sides and bottom to the point I have to scrape it and it’s still wet. as I mentioned I have 1 cat with the other litter never had any issues with smell. Now I can smell her pee and poo 2 rooms away and it doesn’t go away. I switched back to my original cat liter.
customer_reviews.author: katie m

customer_reviews.title: Beats Hauling Around 40 Pounds from Store
customer_reviews.text: During Covid lock down this was wonderful to have delivered. Also, beats hauling a 40 pound bag of litter from Costco. Downside though is this litter is lighter grained than Scoop Away (usual litter) so it gets tracked around the house. Also, doesn't do a good job hiding the cat poop smell. Now that Costco is kind of safe again, I'll be going back to Scoop Away.
customer_reviews.author: Palm Desert Mermaid

customer_reviews.title: Nice scent - but tracks horribly
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying, I've tried just about every multi-cat liter on the market, except this one. So I decided to try this over my regular cat liter I've used for years. While the scent is nicer & more subtle and the dust is much lower, this insanely tracks! I basically need to set up post 24/7 at both liter boxes with a vacuum! Both my liter boxes have oversize no track mats, yet it's on the floor from one end of each room to the other, pieces are in the bed, on the furniture, you name it. Also, while I appreciate the less packaging for the box vs plastic tubs, it needs a handle like the tubs!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy in N.C.

customer_reviews.title: Bulk of a Deal
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal for overall pounds vs. cost. It is very difficult to use this bag to dump into a litter box, which at 40 pounds and in a bag, I anticipated as much. I used a plastic container to dump a good 1/4 - 1/3 of the bag into instead and closed and stored the rest in the bag for later use. My only complaint is the box/shipping. The box only had one piece of tape securing the box shut and with the weight of the bag inside, easily did not hold, making it impossible for transporting and delivering without damaging the box.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieTee

customer_reviews.title: Leaves a chalky/gravel residue all over the house
customer_reviews.text: this litter has a white chalky gravelly rocky consistency to it. It leaves dust, actually fine dust, and little pieces of grit all over. Because when the Cat gets out of the box he has the dust all over his paws and many times the small gravelly pieces between the pads on his paws. It also doesn’t seem to clump or absorb, so I’m cleaning the box more frequently. Then he carries it through the house and I found it on my furniture and in my bedding as it flakes out of his paws, slowly. I will be switching back to the finer sandy like litter I used before and discontinuing this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Retired

customer_reviews.title: Hard working and affordable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried everything when it comes to cat litter and always end up back here. There’s a reason why this stuff is considered an old standby- it works. It just works. It’s easy to scoop, isn’t stinky, doesn’t produce a ton of dust. Sure, there’s fancier stuff out there, but this one always works and works hard.
customer_reviews.author: Alex H.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: The product is great , no complaints from our two cats. The gravel is large enough so that it will not get into the paws and leave a trail out of the cat box. one problem is shipping; when you put 4 packages together at 12 lb each in the same box it is so heavy that the box is partially open and one of the products was leaking. My wife and i can not carry such a weigh; even the mailman left it at the bottom of our stairs. That is why we bought it in the mail rather than pick in up in the store. For our next shipment could they be packed individually.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wantuck

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Great product
customer_reviews.text: Once I tried Tidy cat years ago I've stayed with it. It clumps well so you end up using less litter than other climping litters. I have six cats and with cleaning boxed twice a day people have no idea when they walk on my house I even have one. This size was very economical! Great savings.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda K Buck

customer_reviews.title: Not the best - I like their Free & Clean Unscented Litter better
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Purina Tidy Free & Clean Unscented cat litter but purchased this one to try it out. I think compared to the unscented one, this litter is poorer in clumping power so things easily break down when I'm trying to scoop them. The sand/beads are also smaller so they fly everywhere more easily and it gets messier when the cat leaves the litter box, which can get very frustrating. Also don't really appreciate the smell. It as this apple-like smell that is not so pleasant whenever I have to clean the litter box. Would rather recommend Purina Tidy Free & Clean Unscented Cat Litter!
customer_reviews.author: Seo Young Myaeng

customer_reviews.title: Great clumping litter
customer_reviews.text: This works great. There is no smell from the catbox between cleanings, and the cat uses it with no problems. Very little dust it acts more like sand instead of powder like some of the cheaper versions. It clumps well and is easy to clean. The smell is very faint and even in the same room you just smell nothing instead of an overpowering perfume. Definitely great for the money and ships with prime.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Titan

customer_reviews.title: Best for my Cattery
customer_reviews.text: This bag is the best way for my cattery to buy Performance Tidy Cat Litter with the best savings. I really prefer the lite weight and with a scent by Tidy Cat but I go thru a lot and this is the best savings. Sometimes I think that Prime membership is high but I use shipping so much that over pays for this very heavy box lots a times a year. Also what I do not like about it is that sometimes I have to clean the boxes several times a day and the urine gets very hard to get out if not many hours old. That is my only gripe.
customer_reviews.author: Smiling Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase
customer_reviews.text: a real bang for the buck, bag lasts for months. zero oder, if anyone ever has oder with any litter they are not cleaning the box daily. urine won't settle in the bottom of the pan which will cause oder like with cheap clay products. no one should ever have an oder in their home or they are neglecting the box! I you want to use poor quality clays then you have to dump out when low to soap out the bottom of the box. tidy cat is excellent, used half the bag in 5 months so this is the most economical.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: For the size of this bag, the price is reasonable. I love the cat litter. It clumps well, masks odors, and it does NOT create a lot of dust when scooping or pouring. The same could not be said of the previous cat litter that I purchased - dust was everywhere. I am happy with this litter and will be purchasing it again. The only downside for me is that it's in a bag instead of an easy pour container, but the quality of the litter is worth sacrificing that convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Yadagoy

customer_reviews.title: US "Cat" Customs
customer_reviews.text: These were held by US Customs for 4 days before released to UPS then me. Telephoned to find out why and was told that they can hold anything they want to including a chair. Didn't know my cat litter came from overseas. My car litter was taped back together upon arrival. Still telling this to all who will listen.. They are as amazed as I am.
customer_reviews.author: Kabuki

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - Not the same as the kind in the hard plastic containers form other vendors
customer_reviews.text: This was super dusty and our cats started sneezing. We bought a container from Target and compared - this stuff is either sub-grade litter or a different product all together. Way more dusty and a different smell. I wish I could have more confidence in the authenticity of products sold on Amazon, but this is undeniably a knock off or something weird going on.
customer_reviews.author: SU

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice
customer_reviews.text: Purina Tidy Cats Crumbling Cat Litter. That's right, crumbling, not clumping. When you scoop, half of it fall off and mix with the dry litter. I love my cats but I hate their stinky pee. The price for this was good but it's not doing it's job so i'll try something else.
customer_reviews.author: E. Anil

customer_reviews.title: Clumping not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: It is nice to get a big and heavy bag of cat litter delivered to my door. I can't manage the heavy bags or pails any more so having it delivered is a real treat. I am not entirely pleased with the clumping of this litter though and probably won't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Not dust free.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Tidy Cats Litter for years and never had a problem until I bought this bag. I normal buy the Tidy Cats lightweight pail or the Glade pail and have never had any complaints. I bought this bag because that's all that was in stock and I figured it would be just as good as the others. I was wrong! It absolutely is not dust free! In fact my poor kitties have been sneezing/coughing since about a week after I started using it. It's pretty strongly scented and while it does somewhat clump it sticks to the bottom and falls apart when you try to scoop it. I will not be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: brittany

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it and so does my nose
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this litter but my old holy grail Dr. Elsey's changed their formula so I had to try something new. This is surprisingly a really wonderful product. It isn't very dusty at all and clumps exceptionally well. There is no litter smell at all which I am very sensitive to. The cats love it, we have 3, and have faithfully used the litter box every time since we had to switch from the old HG litter, and we tried several brands (old lady cat started actively avoiding the litter box with other brands like arm and hammer and feline pine). 10/10 will continue purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: S. Street

customer_reviews.title: something changed
customer_reviews.text: This has always been the best cat littler in my opinion. I got a 40 pound bag and it no longer clumped. Not sure if my cat was doing something differently but every time I scooped up her pee it broke apart and ended up stinking up my apartment. Not sure what changed or if I got a different product because I got a different bag but Im pretty disappointed. I'm going to try and buy it in the store next time and hope for better results.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Pare

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is not a clumping litter The cat pee goes straight through it and it smells terrible We have tried two separate bags and due to the fact we could not return the litter we could not get a refund We are very disappointed after $43 spent It literally went in the garbage We had to purchase a different brand and have had no trouble with that
customer_reviews.author: sherry bukoski

customer_reviews.title: Not great clumping and cat hates deodorant smell
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t clump as well as the litter I’m accustomed to and instead sticks to the edges or the bottom. Tried after having used Petco’s bulk litter for years. The deodorant scent is very strong, and my cat hated it. He actually started pooping outside the litter box. I’d put him in and he would smell the litter and jump out.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Never again...
customer_reviews.text: I am so surprised how bad this litter was ..since it had so many good reviews. Literally, the worst litter I have ever used (For over 20 years!). Not joking.. instead of getting rid of the ammonia smells, It tries to cover the smell with cheap perfumes (the smell is so outdated, reminds you of toilet!). Whole floor stinks of this perfume mixed with ammonia. It nauseating. On top of that, it makes so much dust.. only thing is ...it clumps fine. But that’s all. Never buy this litter again.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, doesn't clump well. Cats hated it.
customer_reviews.text: I was swayed by the good price per pound but this stuff is cheap. Really poor quality litter. It doesn't clump as well as other litters and leaves a lot of debris when you clean it out. I have two cats and three litter boxes, they hated using them. Even when I had changed it out that day, my cat said "No thanks" and pooped next to the box. I'll stick to other litters. Quality over quantity, I suppose. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gabbie K

customer_reviews.title: Worst litter we have ever had
customer_reviews.text: While We typically have used Tidy Cat they must have changed their formulation because this litter gets everywhere and actually sticks to my cats feet. We heard our cats feet clicking when he walked and thought his nails might be too long but were surprised because they had been trimmed recently. When we looked he had so much litter in between the pads of his feet that it was making noise when he walked. we’ve had to wash his feet multiple times and each time after he uses his litter box to get this litter out of his feet.
customer_reviews.author: Pete R.

customer_reviews.title: Good for price and amount
customer_reviews.text: Tidy cat is all I use. I love the price I got for four bags and just dumped them as needed into my buckets that I usually buy. They are more dusty and less absorbent as the litter in the buckets. The clumps turned to clay very fast (we clean daily) vs the bucket litter of the same brand. When needing to order from home and can't get to a store, I would buy them again. However if I can make it to the stores, I'll stick with the buckets.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Not buying again.
customer_reviews.text: This litter clumps very well and is easy to scoop, however, it does not help with the scent of cat pee at ALL. I never knew my cats pee could stink so bad until I bought this. I had to buy litter deodorizer and thay does but so much. The fresh step and arm and hammer brand(#1fav) are much better. Wouldn't buy this again, I figured I could rely on the reveiws. I would definitely pay the extra money for another brand so i dont have to spray the crap out of my house with febreze or waste my candles.
customer_reviews.author: Zu

customer_reviews.title: Big Mistake!
customer_reviews.text: I quit buying this brand way back when and just recently ordered it because it was less expensive. Big Mistake! I forgot how easily this stuff sticks to the cat and gets spread all over the house. No matter how good this performs in all the other categories, this is the worst and I'll never order it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ric

customer_reviews.title: Convenient as delivery
customer_reviews.text: Amazon packaging has MUCH to be desired. Opened the package, an moved the bag to the pantry with a trail of cat litter following me (from the “bottom” of the bag I opened. This is ridiculous.. requiring a lot of clean up. I have another bag scheduled for delivery later today (????), and will be irate if the delivery is damaged the same. I should be reimbursed for all of the clean up I had to do!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I have bought other Purina litter, the light weight containers or the big tubs mostly. The 4 bags of 12lb litter arrived in a wet box, bags felt almost stale and hard to open. The pull tabs just kept ripping and disintegrating as I tried to open it.. eventually one of the bags just tore all the way across the middle of the wrapper. The litter on the inside still smelled great and like it’ll do the job for 2 indoor outdoor male cats, one of which isn’t neutered. Not thrilled about the packaging or having a big mess to clean up but happy after all when my local stores were sold out completely of cat litter.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Best Litter Ever
customer_reviews.text: I am completely satisfied with the Tidy Max 24/7 performance. Tidy Cat has been the best Litter that I've used, tight clumps, high absorbancy and odor banning. This is the first time I've used the Tidy Max and I can tell the difference between using the other 24/7. My cats love it and we will continue to use. Product arrived timely without damage. The PKG has a pour option or you can remove the top and scoop out...
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but dust
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this litter for 2 years with little issue. However, recently, I've gotten bags that are excessively dust producing, do not clump and do not even mask, let alone prevent, odors. We won't even talk about the tracking problem and the need to walk around with a broom to keep the tracked litter around the box and off furniture and the rest of the home. I am extremely disappointed and am switching to a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not the litter it claims to be. Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve returned and tried this twice. NOT the same product as the 24/7 performance. It has a STRONG scent and tracks like crazy! My cat developed a UTI the day I filled her litter box, thinking it was the same litter. $185 vet bill later, I would definitely not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GOC

customer_reviews.title: Purina Tidy Cat Litter Not So Tidy in 2020
customer_reviews.text: I have been a faithful Tidy Cat litter user for years, But this new stuff is so fine it’s just absolutely useless. It’s also causing my cat respiratory issues with the amount of dust it makes in her cat box, noticed her eyes watering after she used her box and she had a cough due to the dust it made while she was covering her business. This is a DANGEROUS product for elderly and cats with respiratory problems due to the amount of dust it makes, your fur baby just may end up with respiratory issues so be VERY cautious.
customer_reviews.author: ThePeanutButterKid

customer_reviews.title: BEST LITTER.. EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: I believe that I've tried every cat litter on the market and I love this kitty litter so much that I keep reordering. Awesome fragrance that really keeps 'bad odor' down. The fragrance is not too strong for my nose and it doesn't bother my cats at all. They went right to it, with no hesitation. It clumps great!! Easy to scoop out and seems to last and go much further than other litter that I have purchased. As long as they don't go up in price, I'll continue to re-buy. Would HIGHLY, recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Lov

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much sucks.
customer_reviews.text: 2 starts because it does seem to control odor. It does not clump together at all just falls apart. It is extremely dusty. I usually buy arm & hammer clump and seal but was looking for something a little cheaper since I’m not working right now due to the Coronavirus...not to mention it was out of stock at my local target.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: BIG BOX of cat litter.
customer_reviews.text: The product size is fantastic. But be forewarned; the product weighs enough to cause a hernia. Lift with your legs, safety first heh. I really wish Tidy Cat would chill on the fragrances tho. None of them are what I would call "light". Tbh, the fragrances are worse than the waste. And my cats end up smelling like the litter which sucks too. But the litter (aside from smell) works very well. I've yet to find a litter that does clumping better. So 5 stars for litter function, minus 1 (or 2) for terrible fragrances. Maybe Tidy Cat should consider some focus group feedback. It's seems like their aim is just to overpower instead of neutralize.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Fulkerson

customer_reviews.title: I have tried so many different litters but I like this one the best
customer_reviews.text: I have had Cat's most of my life and I have 2 Siamese cats that are indoor cats, so I have 2 of everything including litter boxes, I have tried so many different litters but I like this one the best,each cat uses they're own litter box( like they have name tags on them) and this litter keeps the litter boxes clean and smelling fresh along with the home also smelling clean, no Kitty smell, and scooping the litter is not a chore - the only One that I use now 😺😺
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Belle

customer_reviews.title: Concrete anyone?
customer_reviews.text: This stuff sets like mortar! I had to chip it out of the cat box. Miserable stuff. Sorry to leave a bad review but hey-
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Dahl

customer_reviews.title: 48lb, 4-12lb bags product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the packaging. It was also the cheapest way to buy it. I open the box at the door and take out each bag after cutting the plastic that holds them together. You only have to deal with 12lb bags and easy to keep near the box. This is also the best product that I have used. We have 2 cats. It clumps well and does great on odor control. This is all that I will buy in the future.
customer_reviews.author: little auggie

customer_reviews.title: Nice BIG bags
customer_reviews.text: The picture shows the bags as skinner than they really are. These are nice good-sized bags of cat litter at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have two kitties
customer_reviews.text: I have two kitties so I need litter to clump quickly so that it is easy to scoop out and Purina Tidy Cat gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: LEJTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Changing brands
customer_reviews.text: Does not mask odor very well and adds a scent of its own to my kitties “deposits” as well and it’s not a pleasant scent persay either. I was on the subscription plan but my last one arrived and when I picked it up from my porch, litter was all over my doorstep as obviously one of the bags was torn. Too much of a hassle to return a ripped open bag of litter so that coupled with the odor, I’m just going to try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I received one 50-lb bag, not 4 12-lb bags
customer_reviews.text: You may wonder why I am not happy about receiving an extra 2 lbs for free. Well, it's because I live in a walk-up apartment and I'm not in my first youth. So far, I've got it as far as the first landing and am contemplating my options. My kudos to whoever had to wrangle this off the truck and onto the porch; the enclosing bag is slippery plastic and ripped all across the top.
customer_reviews.author: Maura Enright

customer_reviews.title: Great value but dust and odor are not acceptable.
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the price, I've purchased this item 3 or 4 times but the dust and especially the recurrent odor over time is unacceptable. The odor gets really musty and unpleasant after a few days (I have 2 litter boxes and scoop every other day). Even with vented window and air filter the unpleasant odor is consistent so decided to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B

customer_reviews.title: Got The Wrong Type!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this is because of the current shortages, so I'll be gentle here. I was expecting the red and yellow label that we grew to love for years. I got the black and yellow label / triple odor protection instead. This stuff is strong, and my cat has breathing/allergy issues. I'll probably go out and score a tub of the 24/7 Performance, and just dilute a little of this at a time.
customer_reviews.author: justjoe

customer_reviews.title: It works great for my 2 cats
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to litter. It works great for my 2 cats. I supplement by sprinkling on some arm and hammer baking soda. The litter is slightly messy, the cats do track it throughout the house but it sweeps up easily. Honestly I bought this on Amazon rather than a physical store because the price was reasonable and I hate carrying super heavy products around a store and to my house (I have a ways to walk from where I park my car to my house). I have shoulder issues so I’m glad I can get it delivered to my front door.
customer_reviews.author: anna swiniarska

customer_reviews.title: I tried multiple expensive stuff, no reason for that
customer_reviews.text: This is the best. Seriously. I tried different stuff, and I couldn't find a better one. Same quality, yes, twice the price. I don't know why this one is the cheapest, if they make it from ashes of roadkills or something horrible like that, but my two cats love it, it smells nice, absorbs amazingly, I really couldn't go for any other litter anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela

customer_reviews.title: Clumps well and little dust but STINKS!
customer_reviews.text: This clumps fairly well (tends to break into smaller clumps so not great but ok) and very little dust which was important. But DOES NOT cover the smell! I don't want a scented litter as I dislike having my cats smell like fake flowers but as I am currently in transit and living in small spacing, covering their potty smell is important and I've had to ventilate my room every day! Not doing the job of keeping the smell down, trying another kind as I have had better luck with other types of Tidy Cats.
customer_reviews.author: sweetlingua5

customer_reviews.title: Shipping was terrible
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in the shipping it look like somebody cut the top open with a box cutter there was part of the litter all over inside the box we actually had to tape the box the bag just so that we could pour it into one of our litter boxes her clean litter that we already have in the future I hope they don’t keep cutting these bags open it wastes a lot of litter
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Monczynski

customer_reviews.title: Hole in bag
customer_reviews.text: I’m really upset by my most recent order. I’ve been ordering this 40 pound bag every 1-2 weeks due to a recent shoulder surgery. It was really helping me not have to carry it from the store. But this was the first time it was sent to me with a hole in the bottom of the bag. So when I lifted the litter out of the box.... it just went every where!!! Really disappointed. Be careful when opening.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: It turns urine into sticky, stinky muck!
customer_reviews.text: I tried this product because I could get a 40-pound bag for about $20. It is an inferior product compared to Fresh Step and Arm & Hammer clumping cat litter. While these other two brands clump very nicely, the Tidy Cat doesn't clump very well; instead, it turns cat urine into a very sticky and awful-smelling muck or mud! This makes it very hard to clean the litter box unless you're willing to take a garden hose to it in your back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Ananias

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: For some reason they don’t deliver the other Tidy cat litter I normally buy on prime anymore so I figured I’d try this one instead it was delivered fine without damage which I had a problem with in the past although I haven’t used it yet I’m sure it will be fine and maybe better at odor control than the other as I’ve been using Tidy Cat litter for a very long time. I only wish it wasn’t so dusty other than that I find its one of the best litters out there.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: CLUMPS GREAT. SMELLS AMAZING.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: smells amazing, really easy to scoop, clumps are hard and stay intact, doesn't leave dust marks on the ground CONS: forms cloud when pouring from box, but that's fine because I recommend using a scoop anyway. the box is WAY too heavy to pour. I grossly underestimated how much 38 lbs was. I will be buying this litter from now on :) way better than dr. elseys litter
customer_reviews.author: Andreya Augst

customer_reviews.title: Black label bag AWFUL!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone else super disappointed with the new black label bag? I’ve been using the 24/7 for a few years and the new black label bag is awful! Reeks of ammonia after a few days, the itinerary does not clump well and literally disintegrates as you try to scoop. I’ll give this one last try before I switch. But overall extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany G.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Pretty bad at clumping. I have bought this same style cat litter in the store and it works great. Idk if it’s length of time sitting in a warehouse or just the conditions of storage/transportation but I wouldn’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: zach king

customer_reviews.title: don't recommend. too dusty & hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: the litter clots, but it's really easy to break into small pieces that will sieve through the scoop, which makes it impossible to clean up. It is extremely dusty, especially newly opened, which caused my cat cough and sneeze very often after use. Scent is okay without strong odor. I wouldn't recommend it just because it makes my cat uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Very dusty and messy
customer_reviews.text: I found this litter to be very dusty. It irritated my allergies when cleaning the litter box. The litter was tracked throughout the house. In addition, the cat urine smell was very strong even though I cleaned the litter box frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Red Ink

customer_reviews.title: Decent litter for the price
customer_reviews.text: I clean my litter boxes every other day because I have 4 cats. I have the metal litter boxes in the hopes of less scent permeating them like plastic does. This litter is heavy so my cats kick less of it out, it clumps well, it does stick to bottom (have yet to find one that doesn't) but absorbs odors well. I have it on auto re-order now
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Gladden

customer_reviews.title: Success!
customer_reviews.text: First time trying clumping litter. I was very hesiate. Living in a newly built home, I was terrified my finicky little dude would hate the change of a new home AND the new litter and communicate that by discovering new area of my home instead. Gratefully, He did the exact opposite. He took to the new litter (and the new digs) like a champ!! I’ve order several times now.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffini

customer_reviews.title: Can't Smell the Litter Box
customer_reviews.text: This is the only cat litter that I use with my cats. It takes about 3 days before you can smell the box, it is inexpensive, and my cats don 't smell like a litter box. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: NINA

customer_reviews.title: I ordered red and got black
customer_reviews.text: I've always used this brand and red is the color I go for. Seems to work the best. But when I received this litter the label was black. So I said what they hey ill try it. Its better then the red. Im not sure if it was a shipping issue thats why I got the black instead of the red, but regardless I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: paul m

customer_reviews.title: We used to love it!
customer_reviews.text: No odor, clumps easily. The only problem is the particles which come out from the litter box to the floor. Update: It is not the same litter we used to buy. This time it does not get collapse and stays wet. Also it smells so bad, it burns your throat and makes your eyes teary. Also there was an issue with shipping, they did not deliver it to my house. We had to pick up the package from the post office. I am 100% not satisfied and disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's cat litter
customer_reviews.text: I mean, let's be real- if you're buying this here it's probably because you've used the brand before and don't want to carry it up several flights of stairs. It's pretty decent cat litter, my girls have never had issue with it. I'm so thankful for whatever delivery person carried this upstairs because it's a heavy heavy box. Which should come as no surprise to anyone who can read the pound label on the listing.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora Westfall

customer_reviews.title: The worst odor.
customer_reviews.text: The scent doesn't mix well with urine or feces, it definitely does not clump as well as they claim, super dusty and messy, and my cats don't like it they prefer the box either Fresh Step. This was a trial run since I've had bad history with this brand but I figured maybe they've changed their formula with time and no, no they did not improve anything. Tidy Cats is a negative for this multicat household!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Best litter to eliminate odor
customer_reviews.text: I needed litter in a hurry and someone ordered this for me because of the 40lb convenience since I run out a lot. I saw that it wasn’t the scent I normally buy but I had no choice. Well, I was pleasantly surprised, the litter box barely had any odor and I have 3 cats. I can go 2 days without scooping, couldn’t do that with other scents or brands. I highly recommend this litter!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathoust

customer_reviews.title: Wheres the Refill Bucket?
customer_reviews.text: 5 Stars because More Bang for your Buck.Smells Great!!!Package was Crushed but Bag intact.I thought this was supposed to come with a Refill bucket...NOPE!!! Am I Surprised? No......that's what you get when you order on-line.You take your chances.I'm good for now but think I learned my lesson...Yeah..Right!....Insanity=making the same mistakes over and over again.Hope this Helps future buyers.PEACE!!
customer_reviews.author: Charlane Valade

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Litter by Purina
customer_reviews.text: My favorite clumping cat litter. It works very effectively, easy to scoop up to keep the tray clean, and the area remains odor free. I liked this particular package as it was 40# and it was delivered to my door; 40# of litter is not as light as a feather. It was delivered on time, and in perfect condition. The price is better than at most stores, so I will definitely buy it again, for all the reasons mention. Sorry I did not take a photo, I usually open it and split it, put it in two smaller containers.
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

customer_reviews.title: Lousy, F
customer_reviews.text: Works well for feces, but is absolutely terrible for urine. Whilst scooping, urine clumps do not maintain their shape and disintegrate into a putrid kind of sand, which ultimately ruins the litter faster and releases an awful ammonia "punch in the face" whenever stirred up. All in all, this is a very inefficient and wasteful litter blend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What’s with the price increase!?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this type of litter for many years. But It’s such a pain to have to get it at the store, then into the car, bring it inside... I like that it’s a 40lb box so it lasts longer. The reason I gave only 3 stars is not because of the product. The problem is the steady increase in the price. From $14.77 in December to $20.19 in March!!! $14.77 through December 2017 $17.72 in January 2018 $18.72 on March 18th $20.19 today, April 9th Seriously? Was there a flood in the crop of litter that is causing this inflation? IT’S KITTY LITTER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy J Abucewicz

customer_reviews.title: Dusty dusty dusty
customer_reviews.text: How disappointed I am with this product the dust that kicks up when scooping is enough to kill you the Oder control is minimal
customer_reviews.author: annette poirier

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy
customer_reviews.text: Hated this litter. It takes a whole bag per litter box. Heavier than other litter I have used. I ordered several bags and they were taped together in a box too large for them. I had to take everything apart on the porch before taking the bags one by one into the house. Terrible experience.
customer_reviews.author: rightimage

customer_reviews.title: Very Strong Smell
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so theres no "kitty poo" smell in the house but there is a VERY VERY STRONG "kitty litter" smell. I guess you win some you lose some. I wish the smell wasn't so strong but anything is better than a pee/poo smell. The cat took a few days to accept the change and had some accidents in the mean time. Given the price I'm happy enough that I made the switch even if the litter smell is kinda strong.
customer_reviews.author: Shumira99

customer_reviews.title: I think 40 lbs of litter for the price of this box is a good deal, but I will not buy again given ...
customer_reviews.text: This litter is well priced. I contemplated whether I wanted to carry 40 lbs upstairs (I am in my late 60s), but that ended up being the least of it. It is near impossible to get the box open. First I tried with a pair of scissors but that didn't get me anywhere to open this tough box Then I tried a knife and then a bigger one. Layer after layer finally gave way. It took me a full ten minutes to get it open, an exhausting process. I think 40 lbs of litter for the price of this box is a good deal, but I will not buy again given the effort described above.
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: Presoiled litter
customer_reviews.text: I use this product all the time as I have a cat. Somehow my last bag already contained cat turds. As I filled my freshly cleaned litter box, I watched turd after turd fall from the freshly opened bag. Never had a problem in the past and hope not to have happen again but every time I dump litter from this bag turds keep coming out. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Puccio

customer_reviews.title: Fresh smelling litter that works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Odor is very mild and pleasant and doesn't seem to bother the cats at all. No dust at all. Compared to some other kitty litter, this one keeps the area free of fine dust. Clumps well, but the clumps do fall apart if I'm not careful in cleaning out the litter box. I wish they would clump into little hard rocks, but I guess that is too much to ask.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Artemyeff

customer_reviews.title: There’s No Handle On the Box.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know who thought it’d be a good idea to design this box without a handle, but...it wasn’t. Does not clump very well. Every time I try to scoop one, it disintegrates. 2 stars because odor control is decent.
customer_reviews.author: Queen of Magical Spirits

customer_reviews.title: Great litter
customer_reviews.text: I'm a firm believer that there isn't a great litter in existence. But this is one of the better litters for the price. Sure I have used better but I'm not working 8 hours a day to pay for cat litter. You can't beat this litter for price performance ratio. If you scoop often it works great. If you skip a few days just make sure to error on the side of over scooping. I have two boxes and three cats and no accidents. Does a good job of eliminating cat stink without over powering perfumes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just bulky packaging
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is the box it comes in is alittle difficult to manage. I put a laundry scoop in it because after I put it in our pantry I struggle lifting it until it is half empty. But it works for my four cats.
customer_reviews.author: MandiMommy

product_meta.title: Purina Tidy Cats Clumping Cat Litter
product_meta.description: Style:24/7 Performance| Size:40 lb. BoxHelp keep litter box odor under control by using Purina Tidy Cats 24/7 Performance clumping litter in your cat family's litter boxes. Made with natural clay plus a slow-release deodorizing system, this litter guarantees 10-day odor control when used as directed, making it ideal for households with more than one cat. Our clay kitty litter offers a clean linen scent to help you maintain a fresh-smelling home. Featuring strong, tight clumping action, the odor control cat litter makes scooping simple. Make your cats' corner of the home a pleasant and inviting space when you fill each box with powerful litter that works hard day and night to keep odors at bay. The convenient packaging permits easy storage in your pantry. For the same great formula you love and the performance you expect, now with a new look, trust Purina Tidy Cats 24/7 Performance clumping litter.
feature_bullets: One (1) 40 lb. Box - Purina Tidy Cats Clumping Cat Litter, 24/7 Performance Multi Cat Litter
If you loved this Tidy... try searching code B07GWGFG2X or B07P62XXS9 for more great options!
Slow-release deodorizing system ensures continuous odor control
Forms strong, tight clumps for easy cleanup and scooping
Low dust cat litter formula for a clean pour

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
